message: Since Flash is hated by Apple, do a show on Flash usage, on the web, iOS (yes Flash is used for iOS), standalone apps, etc.
A dance show with Leo Laporte?
I heard there was going to be a show that's all about Android. TWIA? Android Weekly?
Leo also said he wanted to get back to his "Help & how-to" roots...that is what I watched tss for. Oh, and The Sunday Ads segment was great too.
@coryroush Thanks, I'm looking forward to that show.
@dustdaughter Yep, Eileen and Jason were working on it, I believe.
@dustdaughter yes! It's called All About Android. We'll be coming out of Beta very soon
Construction Technology
@eileentv Oh wow, a show about Android would really rock!
Music creation and performance tech would be cool
Mmm not a show, but sneak peek how AMIGA is doing, they still have some machines coming out.. honestly
2eileentv i watched AAA from your tweet today ... ready for prime time!
Jailbreaking apps, jailbreaking community, who are the dev team etc etc
I would like to see a show about video production, webstreaming, wirecast/vidblaster, etc.

Maybe I'm selfish, but I feel TWiT doesn't discuss graphic/web design enough. They represent photography and video with Alex Lindsay and his gang, but traditional design folks (most often Mac users, and very often tech geeks) are almost never heard from. I selflessly volunteer to host a show on design from my bedroom.
maybe design is too subjective?
Web Development!
this week in Android
Maybe a music tech show? Talk about sequencers, peripherals, etc...
I'd love to see a web development one. Or maybe graphic designing in relations to web dev/UI. :)
Is there room for a kitchen set in the new studio? :-)
@brianpattison for a geek cooking show? :D
Functional programming.
Hrm, I guess that would be a pretty short show, however much I'd love to see it.
A twit cooking show could be interesting. Perhaps similar but better than Foodmob?
Wouldn't mind a show aimed at web design/programming etc. Net @ Night is more generate net stuff.
TWiT needs more shows about Android, and if they added a show about sports I would never need to watch another network ever...errr other then frogpants.com
+1 for web programming show. to put it into context: readwriteweb in a sweet netcast package
It's been talked about in the past, but I'd be interested in a show about enterprise IT.
+1 for programming show
A quick sneak peek about social profit, i still dont understand some parts
They could do a This Week in Charlie Sheen.

@chaddwinston +1 on that one... Music related Technology, hardware, software reviews or at least TWiT-like talk about what happened, what's going to happen and one non-week related topic to chew about :)
@anotherjmartin +1, along with what @chaddwinston suggested too.

@anotherjmartin @chaddwinston I usually listen to SONIC TALK http://is.gd/KxoMTR  (or watch live http://www.sonicstate.com/live/ )  but that's really not enough, IMHO... would love to have another perspective about this subject with another weekly show, preferably a Leo's one would be nice :]
Oh, another subject:  Nanotechnology
How about a tech debate show.  A weekly topic related to tech could be selected and then two guests from both sides could each make their points.  Leo or another TWiT host could be the moderator.
two new subjects:  Artificial General Intelligence and Synthetic Biology
Doesn't matter what the show is, it has to have or star Dvorak.
@Dewbrain Perfect!

Business Meets Technology. How to integrate productivity practices, management, communication, presentation, etc. What tech should you buy, such as projectors, cameras, conference calling, online tools, collaboration. How to give talks and to interact. Have an interview each week by a specialist in his/her business field.
Yeah, "Cooking for geeks"

I think you can take all these topics and broadcast a series of nano-cooking-geeks w/ a couple of hot chics.  Make is clean, sexy and intelligent.  I happen to work in production and we have a really cool cooking show that is intelligent. Add the geek and two hot chics w/ technology - it's the right recipe. Love it! You should test new technology, cameras w/ food and cool beer. Nice. Email me: ninaquroscuro@gmail.com.  I can produce.
Also perhaps a extreme east meets west with guests from europe talking with an american, sharing ideas about culture, privacy, schools and food.
A fine foods and wine show with John C. Dvorak. About herbs, wines, ingredients and recipes, about pure food.
And finally: a show about the gear, just producers really geeking out with guests about microphones, compression, recording, insulation, recording on a budget, etc
@HateBadDesign I'd like to see that!

I learned about Leo as a newb when I found ZDTV on cable. He was doing Call for Help, a show for beginners. I really think there needs to be a be a show for newbs. Got to bring up the next gen of geeks. Job security for Leo!
@sneakerpeet That sounds good being a sound engineer myself I would enjoy that.
@Courante I like the idea!
I would like to see Maxwells House make a comeback, even if Leo participate
@lessfeet Let's do it! :-) Oh, wait I don't work at TWiT ... @leo? ;-)
@sneakerpeet I'm sorry neither do I work at TWiT.

@lessfeet :-) Perhaps @leolaporte likes the idea of an extra show á la gear media tech, with the NAB and other shows it should be able to sustain a flow of shows. Topical, news, opition, old in the field recorders exchanging their experience. I'm sure talking with film recordists can tell stories worth recording.
How to change from a 100% Windows PC based family to 100% Apple IOS based family.. Scared to pulled the trigger on the big move. 2 laptops and a home computer, what is the best way to do this?
A show about spirits with Leo and John Dvorak, they could call it "Sloshed Geeks" ;)
Tech Bizz Weekly: In depth weekly topic on companies, from monsters like Apple, Facebook and Twitter to smaller companies and trends. With a focus on investing and money.

GAMING. It's amazing how Twit has overlooked this segment of home tech. The show would go beyond the kiddy demo. Game designers, game history, most popular games, etc. At the end of an episode, a game or topic would be mentioned for the upcoming episode. Release show  notes would be posted b4 show so that viewers could learn some background of the game. Call it TWIGA ...this week in gaming. (sounding like Elmer Fudd saying trigger :)
How about a show about "Travel Tech" wifi - entertainment - best tech hotels - wifi friendly airports and airlines -  getting your tech through the TSA safely ... etc

@eileentv I like the cooking show idea but have a regular segment of it with low carb eating/cooking that Paul Thurrott and Leo have been doing.  Bring on some nutrition experts, it could be a hack your body type of show.  Review the gadgets and apps that you can tie into the whole theme.

@Josephb76 i think leo addressed about gaming show awhile back. it's just too hard, as you just said there, way too many things to cover,.. they probably need a whole new network just for gaming alone
and if i remember correctly, nsfw show was supposed to be the 'gaming' show...
"Basting Meat" with John C. Dvorak!

i would love to see show about GAMES. it should be show about small teams, "small" games (not about WOW or SC2).  IGF.com - this kind of games. Not for gamers, more for developers, for people who are interested in how they are created.

NEWSFLASH: In all seriousness, a cooking show with a different member of the TWIT crew every week or biweek making a dish could be hilarious. You could have people like Leo and Becky or Lisa make some gourmet meals and people like Tom & Jason make grilled cheese sandwiches/macaroni & cheese or iYaz could make toast.. We need someone who giggles to host (besides Leo) hmmmm I apologize for stereotyping who can and can not cook. At the end of every show, JammerB could taste the dish.

I don't really buy Leos explanation for not making a gaming show, thats like saying you can't make a news show because too much happens.  But then I'm not sure any of those in the cottage knows that much about gaming beyond We Rule and Angry Birds (and that dubious pirate clone of Fruit Ninja that Eileen plays ;)
@KsMusicTech Oh yeah. I'm sold :)
Glee! Come on get with it! :)

Seriously there is a need for a good (I stress the word GOOD) web development show talking about HTML, CSS, UI / UX, usability, etc. Boagworld was a good example but moved away from it to a new format. Surely through the TWiT contact list there is enough super physced developers willing to share.
regional shows: Austin, NYC, London, Paris, etc

I agree with the cooking shows.. but how about a geek personal grooming show?  Tom Merrit already has the beard.. which he has to trip once in a while... shwood has the hair... the ladies can chime in and give their tips.. perhaps a scientific or historical POV and other info...
I only miss a morning show which (after it's live recording) is in a rerun loop the whole (US) morning
Eriks show has no production costs, he does it all himself, he should be on daily

There needs to be some kind of This Week in Education which focuses on technology in education. I have been very successful with the deployment of open source tech in all aspects of our school district and I'm constantly looking for more options.

This Week in Engineering... to cover all the other stuff that is technical but not necessarily digital.  There is a lot of great mechanical, civil, chemical, aeronautical engineering news that geeks can appreciate.  The crumbling U.S. infrastructure and what we can do to fix it could benefit for the This Week In... treatment.
I think we need a show to Silicon Spin...more industry driven.  Maybe a byte cast with Gina Smith?
More Linux shows!  I know there's FLOSS Weekly, but let's have one specifically about Linux, just like Windows and MacBreak Weekly.
Women in Technology - focus on women-led startups, women web designers and developers as well as women end-users.
This week in Facebook could be interesting. About their new features, API changes, acquisitions. And updates on their privacy changes.
Perhaps leo should do a girl geek fashion show - done right it could appeal to both genders.
How about more celebrity geeks or those who use tech. Loved the Steve Martin stuff.

You know seeing Brushwood run around with that liveU gizmo, I'm thinking that is something they should do a lot more. I don't know how expensive that would be,  but it has great flow, and he ends up talking (or scamming ;) everybody along the way.  Very entertaining if not that techy :)

Yes, a 21st century, "Man-on-the-Street Show" would be awesome..lots of locales, spread the tech love. I live in the midwest and it's like the stone-age here except for a few pockets in the city, early adopters, and the young ones that grew up with computers.

I agree on a tech in education podcast. It could focus on tech not only for use by educators, but by students and administrators etc. That would be something that interested me. Plus it could get some discussion going on the type of tech that hasn't been developed yet that is wanted in the education field.  going on tech
How to create an android app.
+1 for the "how to" show. Make it like the giz wiz where they release one ten minute show a day.

TWIT should do a show about books, publishing, ebooks, audiobooks. Even though TWIT focuses on technology I could still see this work if they put a technological spin on it. I'd subscribe in a heartbeat!
@michielb Perhaps also a show about federated social networking ...
Blackberry

I wouldn't want to increase the quantity on the expense of quality. I'd rather see the existing shows being done well and improved over time. Then, after that, if there are resources left, they can come up with new ones. Well, just a thought, anyway. Fewer but better shows might not be that bad idea, either.
@iurus I agree! We would not want shows put together haphazardly.
You can't improve shows like TWiG or MBW, they're top notch
I always enjoy when Leo goes off topic & talks about the "old" computer days.
I want a beer show with Tom and Sarah - each week they find a new pub and taste what they are selling there (all of it)
I concur! @HateBadDesign
Just bring the new BYTE broadcast over, it's surprisingly good right out of the gate.  Although it shouldn't be a surprise since it has Gina... http://mca.libsyn.com/
A newbies show. Two great hosts that are not techies and have someone teach them how to do various things. Like the old days with Leo.
@lyerla2 Yeh! Leo is great explaining stuff to newbs.

Agree with ya! I think a lot of people would like to see a show like that. I remember back in the Screen Saver days. He would be on all day Christmas day explaining how to use all the hot gadgets people got. He even took calls on the air to help people.
How to setup LiveView ??
@chaddwinston That would be a great show. Leo already knows lots of people that could host it like the guy who does the TWiT themes.
sword and laser (Tom + Veronica) + video :) would be cool
Tom said they are not able to do S&L on a regular schedule, this is one reason why they don't do it on twit
+1 for this week in education
We need to find a way to get a Belmont show on Twit. "Who did you kill this week in World of Warcraft"? :)
@HateBadDesign LOL
There needs to be a steam podcast or more windows related topics.   Not everyone uses Mac's and apple products
I agree

I don't understand your implied bias for Apple. MacBreak Weekly <=> Windows weekly. IPad today <=> All About Android.  This Week in Computer Hardware and  PC Perspective have a small Windows Bias.   Yes they have a lot of Mac Laptops, But what else can run Mac OS, Windows, Linux, etc.  Furthermore, Leo has has said the a generic game show doesn't really work for him and breaking it up into specialties is not the market he is looking for.
Vista stinks, Leo said that they should have came out with Windows 7 instead of Vista ( Leo's Words Vista stinks) I 100% agree Leo
I have Windows 7 it is a million times better then Visy

@ljsworld I don't see the bias as implied.  Leo can spend half of WW talking about Apple...  the converse never occurs on MacBreak.  I had to chuckle at the image of every participant on the CES TWiT panel having an Apple laptop or iPad.  It doesn't bother me but it's pretty widespread.
@kyserboy Agreed

How many of these Macs have Mac OS and Windows running on it. A company I consulted with, bought only Mac's but used both Windows and Mac OS on them for conferences. That way they could bias toward windows or macs based on the audience. As far as the iPad is concerned, There really isn't a competitor yet. Android competes with the iPhone but the tablet space has no competition Maybe next year. WW talks about the competition and so does MacBreak Weekly.

How about a show on designing for collaboration?  Kinda niche I know.  There's this cool podcast, Tummelvision that talks about this.  The host (Heather Gold) is really well spoken and might be an awesome TWIT guest.  btw, I'm new to this idea but in a nutshell, tummeling is about cultivating engagement.  It comes out of a tradition of hiring entertainers for a party who don't broadcast 'entertainment' but cultivate entertainment by engaging the audience in innovative ways. It creates an atmosphere/space where people relax and open up.
As i recall they used to do Tummelvision on twit, but Leo didn't think it was a good match.
loved the first few shows... after that, it felt like the show was on rerun
@unwrangle and @HateBadDesign thx!  Good to know.
How about home IT?

why don't make show with different topics... like miniseries. this month we will talk about productivity. different guests around this topic... next month topic will be... we can make our proposition about topics.
"More Linux shows! I know there's FLOSS Weekly, but let's have one specifically about Linux, just like Windows and MacBreak Weekly."   <-- This!
